result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L Blaylock Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA and pay costs if not already done.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges as to all counts, one, two, and three, including any applicable mandatory surcharges, DNA surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
No contact with victim unless authorized or approved by agent.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling, parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug asessment. Successfully complte recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Attend school full time.  No unexcused absences and graduate.

If defendant completes all terms and conditions of probation including payment of financial obligations and there are no reported infractions, the Court will authorize expungement pursuant to 973.015.

supervisions.notes: All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during term of probation imposed in counts one and two.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin L Blaylock Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin L Blaylock in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.
Upon motion of the state, the court orders charges amended to 3 counts of CLASS A misdemeanor Battery, 940.19(1).  
As to each of the counts:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense and defendant.
As to counts 1 and 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to one another with credit for 3 days time served as to count 1.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling ; parenting classes
-Establish paternity and support child.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS authorized or approved by agent.
-Attend school full-time, with no unexcused absences and graduate.
-Defendant to submit DNA and pay costs, if not already done so.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges as to all counts (1,2,and 3), including any applicable mandatory surcharges, DNA surcharge .  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Restitution is set at ZERO.
As to count 3:  
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, school, counseling and Batterers Intervention/parenting classes.  DEFENDANT TO REPORT ON JUNE 15, 2015 BY NOON.
All costs, assessments and surcharges are to be paid during term of probation imposed in counts 1 and 2.
IF DEFENDANT COMPLETES ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROBATION INCLUDING PAYMENT OF FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS AND THERE ARE NO REPORTED INFRACTIONS THE COURT WILL AUTHORIZE EXPUNGEMENT PURSUANT TO 973.015.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Branch 25 is in jury trial and is unable to hear this matter.  Branch 38 agreed to hear this matter on behalf of Branch 25. Parties notified.

Defendant Calvin L Blaylock in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. ADA Kashen was previously in court but was called to Branch 10 and is unable to appear. Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/17/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin L Blaylock in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case heard off the record. Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Parties to file motions by 04/01/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defense has received discovery and State's offer. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Calvin L Blaylock in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Molly Wellman-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Exhibit is ordered withdrawn. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with U.D.L.   AND/OR  her residence   AND/OR  her place of school and/or employment

Defendant Calvin L Blaylock in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-037

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/15 @ 1:30 pm
